page.title: 01TODDINGTON AREA - A SUMMARY
page.content: An agricultural{landscape}predominates in this section of South Bedfordshire. The area, which includes the village of Toddington and part of the village of Harlington, is traversed by the M1 and the Midland Railway line. {Toddington,}population 4547, of Saxon origin, a busy market town in the 18C., is a typical English village. Features include an imposing church, a manor and an attractive centre grouped around the village green. {Harlington,}population 2480, of Saxon origin, has grown rapidly in the last two decades. Of note are its manor, a recreation area and its 14C church. The majority of working inhabitants of both villages commute to Dunstable, Luton, Bedford or London. All residents of the area enjoy easy access both to the{M1}at junction 12 and to Harlington railway station.
